alert.note: Alert for Craven; Pamlico (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 22 at 1:48PM EDT until June 22 at 2:30PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 PM EDT FOR CENTRAL CRAVEN...SOUTHEASTERN BEAUFORT AND PAMLICO COUNTIES... At 147 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Ernul to near Olympia to Cherry Branch Ferry Terminal, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Emergency management. These thunderstorms have a history of producing wind damage. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... New Bern, Havelock, James City, Blounts Creek, Askins, Cayton, Lowland, Florence, Janeiro, Edward, Grantsboro, Royal, Cox Crossroads, Bonnerton, Riverdale, Olympia, Whortonsville, Croatan, South Creek and Maribel. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please send your reports of hail and/or wind damage, including trees or large limbs downed, by calling the National Weather Service office in Newport at 1-800-889-6889. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
